git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@893789 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.BaseTestForBodyD:
This change breaks backwards compatibility but I think is justified. I agree that defaulting is appropriate for TEXT types but is very unreliable for other types. For many types conversion to characters is not appropriate (for example, image/png). For other types, the type itself contains charset meta-data (for example application/xhtml+xml). By defaulting in these cases information is lost: it is not possible to destinguish between the case when the charset parameters is explicitly set to us-ascii and when the charset is unset. Non TEXT types cannot be assumed to default to us-ascii and so this behaviour is potentially dangerous.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.mime4j.field.MailboxField.MailboxFie:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The

org.mime4j.field.AddressListField.parseB:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.AbstractEntity.s:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MinimalB:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.Base64In:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.ExampleM:
Added a new Message.writeTo checker with roundtrip checking for messages (MIME4J-64).
We first check the output against the expected output (.out file). Then we read it and output it again to make sure that starting from our own output a new output will be identical.
Added .out files for existing messages (not all of them are what we really would expect, but they are what currently mime4j outputs)

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MinimalB:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

org.apache.james.mime4j.Event.toString():
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MinimalB:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@1482289 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.Base64Ou:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.mime4j.field.ContentTypeField.Conten:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.Base64Ou:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@1127006 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.MimeEntity.MimeE:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.apache.james.mime4j.AbstractEntity.i:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MaximalB:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

org.apache.james.mime4j.Event.Event(Stri:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.apache.james.mime4j.Event.equals(Obj:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.mime4j.field.DelegatingFieldParser.s:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.


git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@440852 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.MimeBoundaryInpu:
For some JVMs, Sun elects to throw a IOException when an InputStreamReader encounters a zero. For example, see http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4684515. This prevents JAMES IMAP from functioning correct when faced with some large emails. Most clients will simply call this method again if zero is returned so I think that this fix should reasonably safe but please review.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.EOFSensitiveInpu:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@674206 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.CodecUti:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.ExampleM:
Added a new Message.writeTo checker with roundtrip checking for messages (MIME4J-64).
We first check the output against the expected output (.out file). Then we read it and output it again to make sure that starting from our own output a new output will be identical.
Added .out files for existing messages (not all of them are what we really would expect, but they are what currently mime4j outputs)

org.apache.james.mime4j.MimeEntity.advan:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@1482289 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.apache.james.mime4j.MimeEntity.getCo:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.EOFSensitiveInpu:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.mime4j.field.DateTimeField.parse(Str:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.codec.EncoderUti:
MIME4J-273 Update encodeB encoding bytes splitting point.

EncoderUtil.encodeIfNecessary(<unicode string>, EncoderUtil.Usage.TEXT_TOKEN, <number less than 10>) is broken in some cases, such as : https://issues.apache.org/jira/projects/MIME4J/issues/MIME4J-250?filter=allopenissues

The culprit is line
String part1 = text.substring(0, text.length() / 2);
Since the breaking point can be in between one unicode character. Once the string is breaking into two part, part1 will have a broken tail and part2 will have a broken head in this case.

Update test for failing testEncodeEncodedWordSplitForUnicode. Changed parameter is to force word split.

org.apache.james.mime4j.MimeEntity.MimeE:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.mime4j.field.DelegatingFieldParser.g:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.RawEntity.read():
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.stream.LenientFi:
MIME4J-166: added a more lenient implementation of FieldBuilder which quietly truncate MIME fields exceeding a particular max limit; refactored and optimized RawFieldParser and DefaultFieldBuilder. LenientFieldBuilder is also more resource efficient compared to DefaultFieldBuilder as it does not maintain original raw content and also generates less intermediate garbage on heap

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MaximalB:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@1127570 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.BaseTestForBodyD:
This change breaks backwards compatibility but I think is justified. I agree that defaulting is appropriate for TEXT types but is very unreliable for other types. For many types conversion to characters is not appropriate (for example, image/png). For other types, the type itself contains charset meta-data (for example application/xhtml+xml). By defaulting in these cases information is lost: it is not possible to destinguish between the case when the charset parameters is explicitly set to us-ascii and when the charset is unset. Non TEXT types cannot be assumed to default to us-ascii and so this behaviour is potentially dangerous.

Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.

MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.Base64In:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.mime4j.field.UnstructuredField.Unstr:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.mime4j.field.DelegatingFieldParser.p:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.Base64In:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.mime4j.field.UnstructuredField.parse:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. org.mime4j.field.Field.parse(String):
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MinimalB:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.apache.james.mime4j.AbstractEntity.g:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.MimeEntity.setRe:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.mime4j.field.Field.getParser():
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.Base64Ou:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

org.mime4j.field.ContentTransferEncoding:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.EOFSensitiveInpu:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MinimalB:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.ExampleM:
Added a new Message.writeTo checker with roundtrip checking for messages (MIME4J-64).
We first check the output against the expected output (.out file). Then we read it and output it again to make sure that starting from our own output a new output will be identical.
Added .out files for existing messages (not all of them are what we really would expect, but they are what currently mime4j outputs)

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@680976 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@718018 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.BaseTestForBodyD:
This change breaks backwards compatibility but I think is justified. I agree that defaulting is appropriate for TEXT types but is very unreliable for other types. For many types conversion to characters is not appropriate (for example, image/png). For other types, the type itself contains charset meta-data (for example application/xhtml+xml). By defaulting in these cases information is lost: it is not possible to destinguish between the case when the charset parameters is explicitly set to us-ascii and when the charset is unset. Non TEXT types cannot be assumed to default to us-ascii and so this behaviour is potentially dangerous.

org.apache.james.mime4j.StreamCursor.sto:
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.stream.MimeEntit:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.mime4j.field.MailboxField.parseBody(:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@673195 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.CodecUti:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.mime4j.field.DateTimeField.DateTimeF:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MinimalB:
Proposed refactoring for MIME4J-116.
FieldParser has been moved to the dom package and field parsing is expected to happen inside the MutableBodyDescriptor implementation.
Minimal/MaximalBodyDescriptor implementations takes a FieldParser instance and a boolean saying if they are expected to parse every field supported by the FieldParser or only the one used for the descriptor results, so that EntityBuilder doesn't have to know the FieldParser again.

org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.QuotedPr:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.

Second patch from MIM4J-5 https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MIME4J-5. Contributed by Oleg Kalnichevski. Factors out an abstract superclass and interface for pull parser state machine. This will ease the creation of alternatives to MimeTokenStream. Factors state constants into separate classes to improve readability. Removes Cursor. This was originally added to allow first class support for nio. The design cost of this abstract is higher than the likely performance gain.

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.ExampleM:
Added a new Message.writeTo checker with roundtrip checking for messages (MIME4J-64).
We first check the output against the expected output (.out file). Then we read it and output it again to make sure that starting from our own output a new output will be identical.
Added .out files for existing messages (not all of them are what we really would expect, but they are what currently mime4j outputs)

org.apache.james.mime4j.message.MessageB:
MIME4J-262 bugfix of MessageBuilder regarding getDate

Before MessageBuilder produces message that had a getDate that was returning a
non null date instead of null when the message had no "Date" header.

In order to not break old code that do not check for null value, old way to
create a builder has been kept and depreciated. Those old way return a builder
that act exactly the same than before.

New way of building a MessageBuilder has been added and do create a builder that
are not buggy anymore.

org.mime4j.field.MailboxListField.parse(:
Applied patch provided by Rob Oxspring. This patch introduces a FieldParser 
interface and a DelegatingFieldParser implementation that delegates parsing
to other parsers based on the field name. The DefaultFieldParser delegates
to static inner classes of each of the existing Field implementations. The 
net result is that users can now more asily add custom field parsers.

git-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/james/mime4j/trunk@725992 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68
org.apache.james.mime4j.decoder.CodecUti:
Message.writeTo() prematurely closed output stream if transfer encoding is BASE64 (MIME4J-79)
Patch kindly provided by Markus Wiederkehr and Oleg Kalnichevski.
The only change from the proposed patch is the "closed = true" when "len < 0" (in Base64OutputStream) because len == -1 is the way we are notified of a stream end and writing more data would result in corrupted output, so it seems safer to consider the stream closed after that call.
